about.title: Crafted by Nature, Perfected by Time
about.description: From the pristine waters of Zarzis, Djerba, Kerkennah, Mahdia, Qlibya in Tunisia, and Pantelleria, Lampedusa in Italy, we bring you sponges that have been naturally formed over years in the Mediterranean Sea. Our family tradition spans generations, combining ancient harvesting techniques with modern quality standards.

heritage.title: A Legacy Woven from the Sea
heritage.subtitle: For over five millennia, the pristine waters of Zarzis have nurtured the Mediterranean's most prized natural sea sponges. This heritage of craftsmanship and sustainability is what inspires our mission today.
heritage.why_title: Why We Say "+40 Years of Heritage"
heritage.why_description: Although sponge fishing in Tunisia stretches back thousands of years, our family and community legacy began over four decades ago. Since the late 1970s, our divers have been hand-harvesting Mediterranean sponges with care, following traditions passed down through fathers, uncles, and grandfathers.

training.title: Four decades of professional diving
training.description: Our divers trained at the national fishing training center established in Zarzis in 1968.

hub.title: Sponge hub since antiquity
hub.description: Zarzis, Kerkennah, and Mahdia have supplied the world for centuries, with Tunisia being the world's largest producer (1976–1986).

cultural.title: Cultural recognition
cultural.description: The Zarzis International Sponge Festival, celebrated since 1968, honors the oldest fishermen and promotes sustainable practices.

vocational.title: Vocational Excellence
vocational.description: Since 1968, the Zarzis Vocational Training Center for Maritime Fishing has been Tunisia's leading institution, blending tradition with modern techniques and supporting professional diving programs that ensure our divers meet the highest standards.

heritage.claim_description: This +40 years claim highlights not only the personal experience of our family divers but also a continuation of a centuries-old maritime tradition that connects Zarzis to the global sponge trade.
heritage.promise_1: Careful hand collection without chemicals or machines
heritage.promise_3: Sustainable harvesting that preserves marine ecosystems
heritage.promise_4: Certified and authorized for international trade, holding official export certification from the Tunisian Chamber of Commerce and Industry — ensuring authenticity, compliance, and worldwide trust
heritage.number_1: Annually, around 7–30 boats work in sponge hand harvesting in Tunisia
heritage.future_description: Today, we remain guardians of this ancient craft. Alongside sustainable harvesting, we support sponge farming and aquaculture to restore marine populations and ensure that future generations can continue this legacy.
